entry.summary: RAMSTEIN AIR BASE, Germany: The United States and its allies failed during talks in Germany to convince Berlin to provide its Leopard battle tanks to Ukraine, a key demand from Kyiv as it tries to breath new momentum into its fight against Russian forces. As protesters in Berlin called on their govern

entry.title: Allies offer more weapons to Ukraine, but no decisions made on tanks
entry.summary: Western allies have dampened Ukraine’s hopes for a rapid shipment of battle tanks to boost its firepower for a spring offensive against Russian forces.

entry.title: Andrew Tate’s detention in Romania extended by 30 more days
entry.summary: The social media personality was detained in Romania on charges of being part of an organised crime group, human trafficking and rape, an official said.

entry.title: Democrat push to grant Australia a waiver to import nuclear subs earlier than expected
entry.summary: Congressman Joe Courtney says an exemption to tough American arms laws for AUKUS could speed up the arrival of off-the-shelf submarines.

entry.title: Politicians become celebrities for a reason. ‘Jacindamania’ was no different
entry.summary: Her empathy and kindness served as a dramatic foil to some of the more narcissistic, truth-twisting male leaders who have strutted the world stage.

entry.title: Leopard: Mighty German tank long sought by Ukraine
entry.summary: BERLIN: Germany's Leopard, the powerful tank sought by Kyiv to push forward against Moscow, could have a "significant" impact in the conflict. But Ukrainian troops would need to be quickly trained up to use the sometimes complex equipment, and it would also need to be maintained. While European a

entry.title: Bradley, Stryker combat vehicles being sent to Ukraine from U.S. stocks
entry.summary: The Defense Department announced Thursday another security assistance package for Ukraine that will provide Kyiv with about $2.5 billion worth of additional firepower, including for the first time 90 Stryker combat vehicles.

entry.title: China, Russia and cartels pose rising threats in hemisphere, U.S. commander says
entry.summary: The world's attention may be focused on the fighting in Ukraine and the posturing over Taiwan, but there's plenty to worry about closer to home, the commander of U.S. military forces in Latin America said Thursday.

entry.title: No kickbacks: A high-tech recoilless rifle could be in the Army's future
entry.summary: Army troops in the future may very well go into combat armed with a new high-technology rifle that produces almost no kick and can be outfitted with electronics capable of seeing around corners, according to the co-inventors of a new recoilless rifle.

entry.title: 'We shouldn't hesitate': Ukraine, allies fume as Germany balks on tanks
entry.summary: Ukrainian leaders vented their frustrations with European allies, particularly Germany, on Thursday for refusing to send tanks to aid in Kyiv's war with Russia, while U.S. defense officials tried to fend off criticism of a Western coalition that is taking increased fire for its reluctance to deploy its most advanced ground-combat vehicles to the battlefield.

entry.title: Coast Guard monitoring Russian spy ship off Hawaii coast
entry.summary: A Russian spy ship has been patrolling off the coast of Hawaii but so far has remained in international waters, the Pentagon said Thursday.

entry.title: Russia's war in Ukraine has emboldened North Korea to test more nuclear weapons, report warns
entry.summary: Russia's invasion of Ukraine has prompted North Korea to accelerate its own nuclear program and embrace a "first-use" nuclear weapons policy in a bid to deter an attack by the U.S.

entry.title: Navy sacks destroyer's female captain over 'loss of confidence'
entry.summary: The Navy this week fired the first Jewish woman to command a warship due to a "loss of confidence in her ability to command."

entry.title: FBI chief says he's 'deeply concerned' by China's artificial intelligence program
entry.summary: FBI Director Christopher Wray said Thursday that he was "deeply concerned" about the Chinese government's artificial intelligence program, asserting that it was "not constrained by the rule of law."

entry.title: Greek PM Mitsotakis: 'We will not go to war with Turkey'
entry.summary: Greek Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis said Thursday he still believes it is possible to resolve his country's differences with Turkey by speaking with Turkey's president, and stressed that the two neighbors will not go to war.

entry.title: 'Help': Colombia rescues sailor adrift in Caribbean 24 days
entry.summary: The Colombian navy rescued a man from Dominica who says he survived 24 days adrift in the Caribbean on a sailboat by eating ketchup, garlic powder and seasoning cubes.

entry.title: Ardern, high-profile New Zealand leader, stepping down next month
entry.summary: New Zealand Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern, who won unaccustomed global prominence for her political and personal accomplishments while in office, said in a shock announcement Thursday that she would be stepping down on Feb. 7.

entry.title: Ireland's WhatsApp penalty highlights EU privacy turmoil
entry.summary: Ireland fined WhatsApp for breaching strict European Union privacy rules in a case that has exposed divisions among EU watchdogs over how to regulate its parent company, Meta.

entry.title: At Davos, Thunberg visit spotlights lack of climate action
entry.summary: Swedish climate campaigner Greta Thunberg on Thursday slammed corporate bigwigs meeting in Davos, Switzerland, for "fueling the destruction of the planet" by investing in fossil fuels and prioritizing short-term profits over people affected by the climate crisis.

entry.title: New ice core analysis shows sharp Greenland warming spike
entry.summary: A sharp spike in Greenland temperatures since 1995 showed the giant northern island 2.7 degrees (1.5 degrees Celsius) hotter than its 20th-century average, the warmest in more than 1,000 years, according to new ice core data.

entry.title: Germany pressed on tanks for Ukraine; Kyiv airs frustration
entry.summary: Germany faced mounting pressure to supply battle tanks to Kyiv and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy aired frustration about not obtaining enough weaponry as Western allies conferred Thursday on how best to support Ukraine nearly 11 months into Russia's invasion.

entry.title: Lunar New Year tourism hopes fizzle as Chinese stay home
entry.summary: A hoped-for boom in Chinese tourism in Asia over next week's Lunar New Year holidays looks set to be more of a blip as most travelers opt to stay inside China if they go anywhere.

author.name: Tian McLeod Ji, Elaine Kurtenbach, Kanis Leung

entry.title: China accuses 'some Western media' of COVID-19 coverage bias
entry.summary: China on Thursday accused "some Western media" of bias, smears and political manipulation in their coverage of China's abrupt ending of its strict "zero-COVID" policy, as it issued a vigorous defense of actions taken to prepare for the change of strategy.

entry.title: Strikes, protests test French plan to raise retirement age
entry.summary: French workers angry over proposed changes to pension rules that would push back the retirement age are halting high-speed trains, disrupting electricity supplies and taking to the streets Thursday in a day of nationwide strikes and protests seen as a major test for Emmanuel Macron and his presidency.

entry.title: Peru's Andes 'descends on' capital to demand leader resign
entry.summary: People poured into Peru's coastal capital, many from remote Andean regions, for a protest Thursday against President Dina Boluarte and in support of her predecessor, whose ouster last month launched deadly unrest and cast the nation into political chaos.

entry.title: Israeli military kills Palestinian teacher, militant in raid
entry.summary: Israeli troops shot and killed a Palestinian schoolteacher and a militant during a military raid in the occupied West Bank early Thursday, Palestinian officials said, the latest deaths as Israeli-Palestinian violence continues to surge.

entry.title: U.S. set to drop charges that NYPD officer spied for China
entry.summary: Prosecutors are dropping charges against a New York City police officer and military veteran who was accused of helping the Chinese government keep tabs on Tibetans in the United States, a case that U.S. authorities once publicized as an "insider threat."

entry.title: China threat sparks a web of new relationships for U.S. military in region
entry.summary: In the long shadow of rising China, the U.S. and its region-spanning group of allies are forging a complex web of defense relationships, bilateral and multilateral, linking democracies across the Indo-Pacific region and beyond.

entry.title: Virgin Atlantic fined for flying with Delta codes in restricted airspace
entry.summary: British airline Virgin Atlantic has been fined $1.05 million by the U.S. Department of Transportation after the carrier operated flights in restricted airspace in Iraq using Delta Air Lines codes, the department announced Tuesday.

entry.title: Christian persecution rising in Africa, North Korea, advocacy group says
entry.summary: Persecution of Christians is rising in sub-Saharan Africa, threatening a "vast humanitarian catastrophe" for the continent, a support group for victimized Christians said Tuesday.

entry.title: Brazil charges dozens in pro-Bolsonaro riots; more expected
entry.summary: The office of Brazil's prosecutor-general has presented its first charges against some of the thousands of people who authorities say stormed government buildings in an effort to overturn former President Jair Bolsonaro's loss in the October election.

entry.title: U.S., Ukraine top military chiefs meet in person for 1st time
entry.summary: The top U.S. military officer, Army Gen. Mark Milley, traveled to a site near the Ukraine-Poland border on Tuesday and talked with his Ukrainian counterpart face to face for the first time - a meeting underscoring the growing ties between the two militaries and coming at a critical time as Russia's war with Ukraine nears the one-year mark.

entry.title: NATO surveillance planes temporarily deployed to Romania to monitor Russian military near borders
entry.summary: Two of three NATO surveillance planes deployed temporarily to Romania have arrived at an air base near Bucharest, from where they will fly missions to monitor Russian military activity near the borders of the 30-nation military alliance.

entry.title: South Africa will hold naval drills next month with Russia, China
entry.summary: Russia may be an international pariah state over its invasion of Ukraine, but that hasn't stopped South Africa from agreeing to hold joint naval exercises with Moscow next month in the Indian Ocean.

entry.title: Chinese scramble to find leading COVID treatment after national pivot on virus
entry.summary: Patients in China are scrambling to find a leading antiviral medication for the coronavirus after the country pivoted from its zero-COVID policies without having stocked up on a key treatment the U.S. and other Western nations enjoy.

entry.title: Milley holds unannounced visit with Ukrainian top commander to assess war
entry.summary: After a year spent talking on the phone or through video conferences, the Pentagon's top general on Tuesday had his first face-to-face meeting with his Ukrainian counterpart at an undisclosed site in Poland near the border with Ukraine.

entry.title: Norway wants to talk to asylum-seeker from Wagner Group
entry.summary: The Norwegian police unit that investigates war crimes said Tuesday that it wants to talk to a Russian asylum-seeker who reportedly is a former high-ranking member of the private Russian military contractor Wagner Group.

entry.summary:
Directors guide viewers through a scene in their films, showing the magic, motives and mistakes behind the camera.

entry.title: Why retailers are bullish on New York's luxury hallways
entry.summary: Midtown is booming, brokers say, thanks to the return of office workers and tourists. “We are totally back,” said Steven Soutendijk, executive managing director at Cushman & Wakefield. Retailers around Midtown office corridors “live and die with office density, and we’re seeing a noticeable difference,” said David LaPierre, vice president of CBRE. Now, there doesn’t seem to be a shortage of old and new concepts. “It’s like the city and retailers have woken up,” said Jared Epstein, president and chief executive of Aurora Capital Associates. “We had stock on just about everything from Soho to the Meatpacking District, West Village, Midtown and Brooklyn. There’s clothing, food, fitness, healthcare, and interest at every level, with spaces filling up fast. At Madison Avenue on the Upper …
